required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Establishing Predictors of Enlarged Prostate Treatment Adherence: Linking Symptom Improvement to Adherence
clinical_study.official_title: Establishing Predictors of Enlarged Prostate Treatment Adherence: Linking Symptom Improvement to Adherence

brief_summary.textblock: Patient-based surveys will be conducted to evaluate the drivers of medication adherence in patients treated with either 5-alpha-reductase inhibitor (5ARI) therapy, alpha-blocker (AB) therapy, or combination therapy for enlarged prostate (EP). Adherence with EP therapy will be evaluated. The researchers believe that the majority of participants will report that they are compliant with therapy. The data source is a cross-sectional patient survey administered at one time point.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Reporting Compliance With Medication
primary_outcome.time_frame: Cross sectional survey administered once to each participant during a 17-month study period (May 2009 to September 2010)
primary_outcome.description: Compliance was calculated based on the participant's response to the following question: "In general, how many times did you miss taking your prostate medication?" Responses were measured on a 5-point scale. Participants who answered "I never miss a dose of my medication" were considered compliant. All other responses were considered non-compliant.

arm_group.description: Men from the United States aged 50 years or older who initiated medication for EP within the past 12 months.

intervention.intervention_name: 5ARI or AB or Combination Therapy (5ARI + AB)
intervention.description: 5ARI: Dutasteride or Finasteride; AB: Doxazosin, Silodosin, Tamsulosin, Terazosin, or Alfuzosin
intervention.other_name: Hytrin® is a registered trademark of Abbott Labs
Uroxatral® is a registered trademark of Sanofi-Aventis
Avodart® is a registered trademark of GlaxoSmithKline
Cardura® is a registered trademark of Pfizer

study_pop.textblock:
Inclusion criteria:
- Physician confirmed diagnosis of enlarged prostate (EP)
- Age 50 or older
- Resident of the United States with health insurance that covers prescription drugs
- EP is consistently treated with a medication that was intiated within the previous 12 months
Exclusion criteria
- age less than 50
- receiving medication on an as needed basis
- diagnosis of prostate cancer

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Males
- Aged 50 years or older
- Residents of the United States
- Receiving a prescription for an enlarged prostate (EP) treatment within 12 months prior to survey initiation
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with prostate cancer
- no health/prescription insurance
- patients receiving medication(s) for EP on a PRN basis

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Participants were not recruited for nor enrolled in this study. This study is a retrospective observational study. Data from medical records or insurance claims databases are anonymized and used to develop a participant cohort. All diagnoses and treatment are recorded in the course of routine medical practice.

group.title: All Enrolled Participants
group.description: Males at least 50 years of age who were residents of the United States with one or more diagnoses of enlarged prostate and one or more filled prescription medications within the past 12 months for enlarged prostate (EP) (alpha blocker [AB], 5-alpha reductase inhibitor [5-ARI], combination therapy)

group.title: All Enrolled Participants
group.description: Males at least 50 years of age who were residents of the United States with one or more diagnoses of enlarged prostate and one or more filled prescription medications within the past 12 months for enlarged prostate (EP) (alpha blocker [AB], 5-alpha reductase inhibitor [5-ARI], combination therapy)

measure.title: Age, Customized
measure.description: The number of participants who were aged 50 and older and those aged 49 and younger are presented.

outcome.title: Number of Participants Reporting Compliance With Medication
outcome.description: Compliance was calculated based on the participant's response to the following question: "In general, how many times did you miss taking your prostate medication?" Responses were measured on a 5-point scale. Participants who answered "I never miss a dose of my medication" were considered compliant. All other responses were considered non-compliant.
outcome.time_frame: Cross sectional survey administered once to each participant during a 17-month study period (May 2009 to September 2010)
outcome.population: All enrolled participants taking 5-alpha reductase inhibitors and/or alpha blockers

group.title: All Enrolled Participants
group.description: Males at least 50 years of age who were residents of the United States with one or more diagnoses of enlarged prostate and one or more filled prescription medications within the past 12 months for enlarged prostate (EP) (alpha blocker [AB], 5-alpha reductase inhibitor [5-ARI], combination therapy)

measure.title: Number of Participants Reporting Compliance With Medication
measure.description: Compliance was calculated based on the participant's response to the following question: "In general, how many times did you miss taking your prostate medication?" Responses were measured on a 5-point scale. Participants who answered "I never miss a dose of my medication" were considered compliant. All other responses were considered non-compliant.
measure.population: All enrolled participants taking 5-alpha reductase inhibitors and/or alpha blockers

reported_events.desc: This was a survey of participants, and adverse event/serious adverse event information was not captured in the study.

group.title: All Enrolled Participants
group.description: Males at least 50 years of age who were residents of the United States with one or more diagnoses of enlarged prostate and one or more filled prescription medications within the past 12 months for enlarged prostate (EP) (alpha blocker [AB], 5-alpha reductase inhibitor [5-ARI], combination therapy)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: GSK agreements may vary with individual investigators, but will not prohibit any investigator from publishing. GSK supports the publication of results from all centers of a multi-center trial but requests that reports based on single-site data not precede the primary publication of the entire clinical trial.
